author: Cre8tive Mojo
text: 'I had the tropical salad with honey mustard dressing was good but a little bland and smoothie which was good but not the best I ever had. Unfortunately the main person working kept bothering me to leave a google review for free drinks. I originally gave a 4 star for free drinks but he didn‚Äôt think was good enough and then charged me for the drinks! Food is good but people are so pushy and very unprofessional and pushy about reviews! for review!  so unprofessional I will never come back because of this!'

author: Craig O'Sullivan
text: 'Had the Cajun Salmon Wrap with quinoa and sweet potato fried totaling 500 cal
column5: 43g of protein
column6: and 41g of carbs.  The food is quality and seems cleaner/leaner than the average quick service restaurant.  One of their differentiating factors is that they list the nutritional info such as the metrics above.  Staff is friendly as well.'

author: Robert Rose
text: 'Good smoothies. All natural ingredients. Friendly staff. Seems like a good choice.'

author: Matt
text: 'Souzafit‚Äôs a great spot if you‚Äôre trying to lose weight and maintain muscle. They breakdown the macros of each meal within the menu. The staff‚Äôs also very friendly and helpful if you need to add or change your meal.'

text: 'One of the best places to eat in Hoboken. Clean food

text: 'Always a friendly experience! Food is fresh and they are always so accommodating.'

text: 'Souzafit is hands down the best meal prep service in Hoboken that will cater meals to your exact macros or diet. The service is always superb as well!'

text:
'One of my go to places to eat in Hoboken.
High quality ingredients
Big portion size
Lots of meat/protein
Friendly staff
I recommend the chicken quesedilla.'

author: Karen N
text: 'They need to wear masks
column5: especially during the time of COVID to protect the local community. Prices are steep for what you get. The strawberries and kiwi fruit are so sour and they are very skimpy with serving sizes (it‚Äôs like cutting up not even 2 strawberries for an entire fruit bowl‚Ä¶) which I know they can‚Äôt control easily but at least figure out your produce problem if that‚Äôs what the meal is all about. I‚Äôd head to Piki Poke up the road next time for their acai bowl.'

author: Jeffrey Becker
text: 'Great food and great service!  Some of the extremely weak complaints featured here are from people who have nothing better to do than complain.'

text: 'Really bad service and decent food. Do not even try'

author: nycentral tours
text: 'Horrible food and disrespectful service.'

author: Angela Frid
text: 'I feel bad writing a negative review because they had such friendly service and I have worked in several restaurants. I didn‚Äôt realize until after I already paid that not a single staff member was wearing a mask which seems not only unsafe for the customer but contrary to their healthy lifestyle branding. The cajun salmon wrap was tasty but the salmon still had the skin on.'

author: X Boone (The FiG)
text: 'Shout out to souza fit for making  a Medium rare burger close to well and dryer than whoopin coughss The menu is super dope
column5: really detailed and I love the fact that you can see the stats of your meal like boxing games. The shrimp tacos were the best part of the meal and yet I am STILL not full. Get regular fries.'

author: Michael Rufino
text: 'The food was fantastic
column5: the staff was friendly and helpful
column6: but what made the experience even better was that the resturaunt lists the calorie and macro content of most dishes. This is extremely beneficial for anyone on a diet
column7: or those that are a bit more conscious of what they intake. Unfortunately
column8: Souzafit does not detail any of the nutrition facts past macros
column9: leaving out the sodium and sugar content. It also does not list the calorie count of sides or of specific plates. If those two things were addressed
column10: then this would be five stars

author: Bryan Hricay
text: 'The staff at SouzaFit are amazing
column5: they treat me like a VIP every time I dine here! Tasty
column7: and reasonably priced. Plus they provide the "macros" on the menu if you\'re tracking what you eat.\n\nRecommend the barbell salad with chicken and protein coffee to give you an extra jolt!'

author: Helder Rodrigues
text: 'In response to Alee
column5: while Google reviews the negative dispute which has nothing to do with the quality of their food or their business model.\nI\'m sorry to hear you had a bad experience at their restaurant. I would like to take this opportunity to assure you that they have not done anything illegal or unethical. The withhold of your last paycheck because of the key and staff apparel not being returned is very common in most business. No business owner wants to have a non-employee with a key and alarm code. It\'s a safety issue. Christina reached out to you for two weeks
column6: asking you to return the key. They had to take measurements to protect their assets and business after you informed about the loss of such and clearly showing a immature and irresponsible behavior. Your statement about them being "miserable" is very unfair and untrue. Felipe and Christina are both hard-working people who care about their business and their customers -- you should know that they often work 12-14 hour days without taking breaks just so they can keep up with all of the orders coming in and making sure all 3 locations run smoothly as possible! Always on the road and commuting over 45 to 1 hour to assist the staff in anything they can.\nThey\'re always looking for passionate and committed individuals to help service the community. So
column7: please do reach out if there\'s any other way to solve this matter because they have community support that can back it and a negative review will be reviewed and we won\'t let these behaviors after their day-to-day.'

author: Gabriela Medina
text: "They dont even count the calories the right way so if you think you're eating something with 300 calories you might be eating 700 or more. I dont recomend this place"

author: Andrew Price
text:
"Pros:
- Food was decent.
- Service was fast.

Cons:
- They add on a credit card fee. No warnings on the menu
column5: or signs in the store. It leaves a bad taste to be charged without knowing beforehand.\n- The cashier pulled his mask down to talk to me and while he was on the phone
column6: the chef had his mask off half the time while cooking.\n- They had indoor dining. Didn't look like 25% capacity
column7: because I don't know how they could fit in 4x the chairs outside of the pandemic.\n- Their bundled ketchup sachets included HFCS
column8: which is disappointing for place advertising healthy food."
